blocks.text: The Yaesu FT-991A is an HF/VHF/UHF all-mode transceiver with 100W on HF/50 MHz and 50W on 144/430 MHz. It features a 3.5 inch TFT touch screen, C4FM digital mode capability, real-time spectrum scope, and built-in antenna tuner.

The AMS (Automatic Mode Select) function recognizes whether a station is transmitting C4FM digital or analog FM and automatically switches to match. DG-ID (Digital Group ID) allows group communication, while DP-ID (Digital Personal ID) enables private communications between registered transceivers.
The GM (Group Monitor) function automatically finds stations with GM enabled on the same frequency and exchanges position information. Distance and direction to other stations can be displayed.
The spectrum scope provides real-time visualization of band activity. The waterfall display shows signal strength with color differentiation. Touch the scope display to tune to signals directly.
The C.S (Custom Switch) button can be assigned to any menu item for one-touch access. Band Stack operation stores multiple frequencies per band for quick recall.
The FT-991A includes a built-in TCXO with +/-0.5 ppm frequency stability. No external reference oscillator is needed for stable operation.
Access the menu via the Function Menu displayed on the TFT screen. Use the touch screen or MULTI knob to navigate. The C.S button provides one-touch access to a user-assigned menu item.

blocks.name: DIMMER
blocks.description: Adjusts display brightness for comfortable viewing in different lighting conditions.

blocks.name: VFO COLOR
blocks.description: Customizes the VFO frequency display color.

blocks.name: My Call Sign
blocks.description: Stores your callsign for display and C4FM digital identification.

blocks.name: DG-ID TX/RX
blocks.description: Sets Digital Group ID numbers (00-99) for transmit and receive. Setting both to 00 allows communication with all C4FM stations.

blocks.name: C.S (Custom Switch)
blocks.description: Assigns any menu item to the C.S button for one-touch access. Select from the function menu.

blocks.name: GPS Function
blocks.description: Enables GPS positioning for location display and GM function. Connect GPS receiver to GPS/CAT jack.

blocks.text: Reset options include Full Reset (returns all to factory defaults) and Full Reset Except SETUP settings (preserves basic configuration).
Connect a straight key, paddle, or external keyer to the KEY jack on the front panel. The built-in electronic keyer supports iambic operation with adjustable speed and weight.

blocks.name: Keyer Speed
blocks.description: Adjusts electronic keyer speed in WPM.

blocks.name: Keyer Weight
blocks.description: Sets the dot/dash ratio (weight) for personalized timing.

blocks.name: Keyer Mode
blocks.description: Selects keyer operating mode: Straight, Bug, Iambic A, or Iambic B.

blocks.name: CW Delay Time
blocks.description: Sets break-in delay time for semi break-in operation.

blocks.name: CW Pitch
blocks.description: Adjusts the sidetone and receive audio pitch frequency.

blocks.text: Contest Memory Keyer stores CW messages with support for contest number programming and automatic increment. CW Spotting (zero-beating) helps accurately tune to received CW signals.
The FT-991A includes two roofing filters: 3 kHz and 15 kHz. These dramatically attenuate out-of-band signals in the first IF stage, improving performance in crowded band conditions.
The WIDTH knob narrows the DSP passband symmetrically. The SHIFT feature moves the passband to eliminate interference on one side. These allow extracting weak signals from interfering pile-ups.

blocks.name: CONTOUR
blocks.description: Provides gentle DSP passband shaping rather than sharp cutoff. Very effective for making weak signals rise above interference. Adjustable frequency and bandwidth.

blocks.name: IF NOTCH
blocks.description: Eliminates narrow heterodyne interference from the passband. Works in SSB/CW/RTTY/DATA/AM modes.

blocks.name: DNF (Digital Notch Filter)
blocks.description: Automatic tracking filter that attenuates multiple beat signals, even when frequencies are changing.

blocks.name: DNR (Digital Noise Reduction)
blocks.description: 15-step adjustable noise reduction with algorithm optimization for different noise types.

blocks.name: IF Noise Blanker (NB)
blocks.description: Reduces pulse-type noise from ignition systems. Adjustable level control.

blocks.name: IPO
blocks.description: Intercept Point Optimization maximizes dynamic range and enhances close multi-signal characteristics, especially useful for weak signals near strong broadcast stations.

blocks.name: Audio Peak Filter (APF)
blocks.description: CW audio peaking filter that narrows audio passband around the CW pitch frequency.

blocks.text: The FT-991A operates from 13.8V DC (+/-15%) with negative ground. It is designed for base, mobile, or portable operation with appropriate power supply.
Do not use voltages other than the specified power supply voltage. Observe correct polarity when connecting DC power. Never cut off the fuse holder from the power cable.
The FT-991A includes a high-speed relay-switching antenna tuner covering 1.8-50 MHz. The 100-channel tuning memory allows instant recall of previously tuned settings.
The tuner matches impedances from 16.7-150 ohms on HF (1.8-30 MHz) and 25-100 ohms on 50 MHz.

The optional FC-40 external antenna tuner can match wire antennas to within 2:1 SWR on 160 through 6 meters, typically in less than 8 seconds. Matching settings are automatically stored for instant recall.
The ATAS-120A active-tuning antenna system can also be used for mobile operation. Mounting bracket MMB-90 is available for vehicle installation.

Listen on the frequency before tuning to avoid interfering with stations already in QSO. The FC-40 stores settings and assumes the same antenna will be used when that frequency range is selected later.

rows.name: Operating Modes
rows.value: CW, AM, LSB, USB, FM, C4FM, F2D (data)

blocks.name: Reset microprocessor
blocks.description: Use Full Reset to restore factory defaults, or Full Reset (Except SETUP settings) to preserve basic configuration.

blocks.name: C4FM not connecting
blocks.description: Verify DG-ID settings match the group. Set both TX and RX to 00 for universal C4FM communication. Check AMS is enabled.

blocks.name: GPS not working
blocks.description: Connect GPS receiver to GPS/CAT jack. Enable GPS function in menu. Allow time for satellite acquisition.

blocks.name: GM not finding stations
blocks.description: Ensure GM function is enabled on all stations. All stations must be on same frequency with GM active.

blocks.name: TFT display issues
blocks.description: Dead or always-on pixels are normal for TFT technology. Color unevenness depends on viewing angle. Clean with dry soft cloth only.

blocks.name: Voice memory not working
blocks.description: Voice memory is optional and supports 5 channels of up to 20 seconds each. Verify feature is enabled and memory recorded.

blocks.name: Split operation
blocks.description: Use TX Clarifier for split operation, or use dedicated split frequency function. A/B and A=B buttons manage VFO settings.

blocks.name: Clock adjustment
blocks.description: Adjust clock in setup menu. GPS can provide automatic time synchronization when connected and enabled.
